discussion.content: The answer should be B based on Kim Heldman, CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 2nd Edition, Sybex, Indianapolis, 2017, p. 328

comments.content: Second this. Project Management Plan defines how the project will be carried out, it shouldn't have status updates on milestones.

questions.question_text: When an action is taken on a risk, which of the following is being done and which document needs to be updated?

choices.C: Avoiding risk, and the risk review document should be updated
choices.D: Exploiting risk, and the risk register should be updated.
choices.B: Accepting risk, and the risk review document should be updated
choices.A: Mitigating risk, and the risk register should be updated

discussion.content: I think A would be right if the question asked "When an action to lower impact of a risk is taken,"... Which isn't taken action but rather preparing for it. Exploiting usually only happens in the event of a positive risk. But is seemingly correct. I pick D.

questions.question_text: A project schedule lists a resource as 50% because it likely:

discussion.content:
A. is a shared resource.

When a resource is listed at 50% in a project schedule, it typically means that the resource is shared between two or more projects or activities. This allows the resource to divide their time and work on multiple tasks simultaneously. By listing the resource at 50%, the project manager is indicating that the resource will only be available for half of their time, and that other projects or activities may also require their attention.
Team Building seems more like a soft skill to promote forming/norming... I believe this should be B. Team Selection

Selected Answer: B
It should be Team selection. Successful project completion requires team members with the right skills, knowledge, and ability to deliver project deliverables. Project managers must identify from the resource pool the ideal individuals for the team.

Team building is the process of taking a collection of individuals with different needs, backgrounds and expertise and transforming them by various methods into an integrated, effective work unit. PMI.org

Selected Answer: B
Team Building is a technique for making your existing team more comfortable and familiar with each other. Question clearly indicates the team hasn't even been formed yet.

Selected Answer: B
Team Management during a Project Team Member Selection Team member selection is a process that involves mapping of skills and strengths of each individual member with that of the role and the job description for which they are being hired or taken into the team.

Team Selection. Feddersen, Brett, CompTIA Project+ Practice Tests, Question 205, very similar to this examining skills on candidates, etc, answer "A project is represented by the individuals on the team, and ensuring the correct skills,
level of experience, availability, and interest are all part of the team selection process."

I think the answer is still A. Surprising Team Selection isn't a term used lots in project management but team building is. In fact, pmi.org defines team building as the process of taking a collection of individuals with different needs, backgrounds, and expertise and transforming them by various methods into an integrated, effective work unit.
